intro: Trigonia nivea, commonly known as the white trigonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has a robust, woody stem and broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky hair. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found near water sources in its natural habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
